instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00281: What is 820-00281? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PP5V_S4: What is PP5V_S4? PP5V_S4 is a 5v power rail present when the machine is in an S4 suspend to disk state..
definitions.PLT_RST_L: What is PLT_RST_L? This is an abbreviation of “PLT_RESET_L” – when you see “PLT_RST_L", assume the person meant to type PLT_RESET_L.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> starts no boot VCore stays above 1V
threads.message:
Fan spin and will cycle off and back on without the battery connected. 

I tested Out of the mac board only.

corrosion around <CHIP>U5710</CHIP> (no stuff) pins 13-18 and pad 2 of <RESISTOR>R7512</RESISTOR> is gone there but still get 5V at <SIGNAL>PP5V_S4</SIGNAL> and diode mode/voltages of those SCL/SDA lines seem good.
Corrosion at pin 1 of CA326 so I replaced it. diode check there looks ok and get 12.65V there.

MOst rails present but no PPVCCGT Ph1 or ph2
0Vat LB700: <SIGNAL>5VUSBCT_LL</SIGNAL>

Not sure if the fact that it cycles power once without battery and then stays on is a sign of life or not. 

<SIGNAL>PLT_RST_L</SIGNAL> is 3.3V and steady.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> starts no boot VCore stays above 1V
threads.message:
VCORE should drop bellow 1V after 5-10s, if really boots.
iGPU voltage doesn't come on until high graphics load is detected.

Possibly other components, or traces damaged by corrosion.
Can also be BIOS issue, try known good one.
Accumulated crap under BGA chips is an option too.
